overview:
Paco Sandejas, Ph.D. is the Managing Partner of NarraVC. He also serves as the Managing Director of BGN Ventures, a Philippine-based management and consulting company focused on technology ventures in the same space as NarraVC. Narra’s investment thesis does not only consist of commercializing promising IT, Clean and bio-related technologies but also strives to bring such to the developing world or allowing Asia to contribute to the process in borderless fashion.

Earlier, Paco was Vice-President of H&Q Asia Pacific. Passed notable investments of Paco have been in Transmedia (now CISCO), SiRF (now CRS), Inphi, and Sandbridge. He serves on the board of Yatown, Quintic, Astute Networks, and Stratpoint Technologies.

He completed his Ph.D. and M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University. At Stanford, Paco co-invented with Professors David Bloom and Olav Solagaard the Grating Light Valve, a silicon MEMS spatial light modulator. The GLV is the core fundamental technology of Silicon Light Machines (acquired by Cypress), Sony and a number of other companies that apply it to displays, printers and optical communication systems.

Paco is an active consultant with the Philippine Government and engineers to increase the economic contribution of IT companies to national growth. He advises the Philippine Department of Science and Technology, De La Salle University, and University of the Philippines. Paco sits on the board of the Philippine Development Foundation, Credit Information Corporation. He is a co-founder of the Brain Gain Network, a web platform connecting the Filipino diaspora, making their ideas into realities to help spur the Philippinesâ€™ growth technologically and economically.
